Description: Foot and floor sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery stemless cup or bowl; slightly flaring ring foot (only stem preserved); glazed save for underside, which has dot and circle at centre and red line around perimeter; added red on collar at top of outer face of foot. Inscription on floor.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ12(?) near the top of the excavations
Curator's comments: Name, Heragoreus. A rare variant of Heragores. The shape must have allowed the cutting of the text on the floor, which here is very flat; perhaps a fairly early type C cup, akin to Sparkes 1970, no. 398, though the treatment of the underside is not readily parallelled.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 66, no. 804, pl. XXI, no. 804)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 687, no. 452)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1654)
